 
{{Client function}}
This function is used to return the volume level of the specified [[/sound.md|sound]] [[/element.md|element]].
{{New feature/item|3.0132|1.3.2||
If the element is a [[/player.md|player]], this function will use the players voice.
}}
==Syntax== 
<syntaxhighlight lang="lua">float getSoundVolume ( element theSound )</syntaxhighlight> 
{{OOP||[[/sound.md|sound]]:getVolume|volume|setSoundVolume}}
===Required Arguments=== 
*'''theSound:''' the [[/sound.md|sound]] [[/element.md|element]] which volume you want to return. 

===Returns===
Returns a [[/float.md|float]] representing the volume level of the [[/sound.md|sound]] [[/element.md|element]], ''false'' if invalid arguments were passed.

==Example==
This example creates a sound then outputs the volume for it.
<syntaxhighlight lang="lua">
function wasted (killer, weapon, bodypart) 
	local sound = playSound("sounds/wasted.mp3") --Play wasted.mp3 from the sounds folder
	outputChatBox("Wasted Sound volume: "..getSoundVolume(sound)) --outputs to the client the volume of the sound
end
addEventHandler("onClientPlayerWasted", getLocalPlayer(), wasted) --add the event handler
</syntaxhighlight>
